description: If an error occurs, there will be checked if the errorClass is configured
to trigger an immediate signalling. If so, a trap will be send to the
management station containing the information shown above.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD H150E-MIB::sendAlarm H150E-MIB::h150eErrorIndex i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eErrorDateTime s EXAMPLEE H150E-MIB::h150eErrorClass i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eErrorCode i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eAccessSlot i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eAccessPort i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eErrorDescription s EXAMPLE H150E-MIB::h150eSysState i 1 H150E-MIB::h150eErrorSeverity i 4

$SNMPTRAPCMD H150E-MIB::sendAlarm H150E-MIB::h150eErrorIndex i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eErrorDateTime s EXAMPLEE H150E-MIB::h150eErrorClass i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eErrorCode i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eAccessSlot i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eAccessPort i 9999 H150E-MIB::h150eErrorDescription s EXAMPLE H150E-MIB::h150eSysState i 1 H150E-MIB::h150eErrorSeverity i 1

description: Identification of an table entry enabled by this index.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eErrorIndex

description: Time, when the error occurred.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eErrorDateTime

description: Contains the error class number (type of trap).
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eErrorClass

description: Contains the error code.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eErrorCode

description: Contains the access slot for the error.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eAccessSlot

description: Contains the local access port of the error. Local means
that port numbering starts with 0 for each card.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eAccessPort

description: Detailed information about errors.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eErrorDescription

description: The actual error state of the device. Contains the highest
severity level of the recent error events. This object is
updated automatically, but it can also be modified manually.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eSysState

description: Contains the severity of the specific error.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eErrorSeverity

description: The CDR notification trap is sent to trigger further actions by the management
station, for instance download of CDR data.
Index of last CDR notification trap sent by device
Note: only reset possible (0)
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eIndexOfLastCdrNotificationTrap

description: Type of last CDR notification trap sent by the the device:
(1) : error - CDR buffer overflow
(2) : warning - CDR buffer is filled up over 80%
(3) : notification - administrateable CDR buffer threshold is reached
-> extern TFTP client has to get the collected CDRs
(4) : warning - TCP Client couldn't reach administrated server
(5) : warning - TFTP Client couldn't reach administrated server
(6) : warning - TFTP Client couldn't reach administrated alternative server
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150etypeOfLastCdrNotificationTrap

description: Textual description of last CDR notification trap sent
by the device
variables.name: H150E-MIB::h150eDescriptionOfLastCdrNotificationTrap

description: The 'port status change' notification trap is sent to trigger a polling of the
port table by a management station. It indicates one or more changes in port
states.
Index of last 'port status change' notification trap sent by the device.
Note: only reset possible (0)
variables.name: H150E-MIB::indexOfLastPortStatusNotificationTrap

description: This trap is sent (to UM proxy), as the system detects changes.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD H150E-MIB::sendUmRelatedChangeNotification H150E-MIB::umTrapIdentifier i 9999 H150E-MIB::umTrapType i 0 H150E-MIB::umTrapLogicalPortNumber i 9999 H150E-MIB::umNetworkElementKey s EXAMPLE

description: Unique identifier of the trap. A SetRequest with value 0
removes the entry from the table. A value unequal to 0
is erroneous.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::umTrapIdentifier

description: The type of trap sent. Startup traps are sent as the
system resets. The 2 types of modify traps aim on
distinguishing between modification that are subscriber-
related and those that are global.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::umTrapType

description: In case of a modifySubscriber-type trap, the logical
port number that was the reason for the traps is
presented here. For the other umTrapTypes, the content
is undefined!
variables.name: H150E-MIB::umTrapLogicalPortNumber

description: A key that uniquely identifies the node towards UM.
For a HiPath 3000/5000 this would be the IP-address
A simulator should additionally provide the port.
variables.name: H150E-MIB::umNetworkElementKey
